title: Undergraduate Researcher
summary: I am working on the Pylot project, an autonomous vehicle platform, using computer vision techniques to improve lane detection.

title: Software Engineering Intern
summary: I worked on the front-end in the Files team, enhancing content sharing experience on Slack and
tool: React, Redux, HTML/CSS, Javascript, SQL, Hack

title: Software Engineering Intern
summary: I built an automated performance testing pipeline on the Mobile Security Team that uses sampled data for analysis to provide easily interpretable statistics and alerts incase of performance differences between product releases.
tool: Python, Pandas, SciPy, Docker, Jenkins, Kotlin

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
summary: I am a research assistant for Professor Williams and Professor Sudmant, assisting them in their joint research project to find a molecular basis for convergence of dormancy. To meet this goal, we are in progress of developing a general pipeline uses large data sets of protein sequences from genomic databases and puts them in a suitable form for analysis.

title: Web Committee Co-Director
summary: I help lead the website committee of the Berkeley branch of IEEE. As part of the committee, I helped update and develop features for our organization's website. As a director, I lead the redesign of the website, making it more visually appealing and responsive across devices.

title: Software Engineering Intern
summary: I work with the lead developer on creating features on our product, a website that establishes a connection between growing start ups and college students interested in working at start ups. I developed the chat feature which allowed users to directly contact each other on the platform and made other enhancements.
tool: Django, React, SQL, Python, HTML/CSS, Javascript

title: Undergraduate Researcher
summary: I conducted research on brain atrophy from chronic neurodegenerative diseases at the computational level. Cooperated with other student researchers to develop a model that corresponds to the brain atrophication process.
